alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 3:02PM MST until December 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 to 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Dobson Pass, Lookout Pass, Fourth Of July Pass, Pinehurst, St. Maries, Fernwood, Kellogg, Osburn, Mullan, and Wallace. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM Wednesday to Noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
